column1: back of a length, on leg, and pumped over deep backward square leg! What a pull. Intent set...
full and wide outside off. Sliced over point, and that dribbles away for another four
reverse paddled! Full, on off, but he goes cross-legged before swiping a shot over short third man
back of a length, slower ball again. Pulled to deep midwicket
high in the air and Nair - at short fine leg - can't get to it to take the catch. Ball was always swirling away from him. Lynn sliced this short ball into orbit
slower ball, back of a length outside leg. Swiped to square leg
low full toss, outside off, and he slaps this through the hands of point! Races away. Was that a dropped chance? Oh yes it was. Sams, the fielder, is having a bad start to this match
back of a length, on leg stump. Looks to pull but misses. Through to the keeper
length ball, on off. Flat-batted to mid off for a single
back of a length, on middle. Cramping Banton for space. Gloves a pull to the leg side
boom! Over the bowler's head. Full on off stump and thumped to long off for four
even better! Full, in the slot on off stump, and Lynn clears his front leg before clobbering a six over long off
back of a length, on middle. But Lynn backs away before muscling a pull over the fielder at midwicket. Another massive over
missed stumping! Length ball angling away and Banton comes down the wicket. Misses, but the keeper fumbles too
yorker length, on leg stump. Dug past the bowler to long on
yorker length, outside leg stump. Dug down to long on again. Very accurate so far
good length, outside off and angling further away. Banton offers no shot and the umpire calls it a wide
top edged over the keeper but falls short of the fielders inside the circle. They give it a chase, and a slide helps Thunder stop a four. This was a sweep that took an edge
clubbed! Fullish, outside off, and he goes down on one knee before flat-batting a shot over wide long on
full, on leg stump. Banton misses the flick, and runs across for a leg-bye
full, on off. The reverse sweep finds point
thumped! Good length, on off, and he makes a settled base before muscling a shot over wide long on

full, on off, and he skips down the ground to smash it over the bowler's head. Doesn't have the distance this time, and Doggett - at long on - gets under it. Takes the catch but falls backwards trying to complete it. The ball falls beyond the ropes too. Dropped and six
arm ball, on middle, and he clears his front leg before depositing a six beyond cow corner
four in a row! Full. just outside off, and he smacks a flat-batted slog into the Heat dug out! Over long on
second fastest fifty in the BBL! Full, on off, and drilled over wide long on
back of a length, on off. Pulled to deep midwicket
full, outside off, and he goes for the reverse sweep. Misses altogether
back of a length, slower ball on middle. Pulled along the ground to deep backward square leg
full toss, outside off and Lynn walks across the stumps before paddling a six beyond fine leg! Played as square as possible
full toss, wide outside off. Punched to long off
full toss, just outside off. Drilled down to the fielder at long on. Applause for Banton
good length ball, angling in. Clears his front leg to go leg-side, but inside-edged onto his body
what a catch! Back of a length, on off, and he tries to pull from over his head. Slapped to the leg side, and the fielder at deep midwicket slides forward to take a difficult catch
good length, on off. Slapped to cover for a single
length ball, angling in. Flicked to fine leg for a couple
full, just outside off. Goes for an expansive drive but a thick outside edge takes it past the keeper's right
what sound off the bat! Length ball angling in, and flicked nonchalantly into the stands beyond deep midwicket
full, on leg, and he gets down on one knee to sweep behind square for a boundary
slower ball, full on middle. Driven inside-out to long off
slower ball, full on off. Goes for a big swipe, and toe-ends the shot to long on. Morris calls and takes it with ease
good length, on leg. Muscled to long on
deceived by the slower ball. Full, outside off, and keeping low. Through to the keeper
yes he can! Back of a length, on off, and he walks across to paddle over third man. Short fine leg runs across to take the catch
full and wide outside off, but within the tramlines. Cutting misses and they scamper across for one, but the keeper throws the ball down at the stumps. Replays show Prestwidge is fine
full, on off, and the attempted drive takes a thick edge over short fine leg. Fortuitous

back of a length, on middle. Pulled into the gap near deep midwicket, where Ross intercepts. But he's sliding across the ground, and his body is too close to the boundary line, but he manages to leave the ball before going over the line. Doggett collects and throws it to the keeper, but replays confirm that's four
quick and fast. Back of a length, on off, and the ball zips past his ear to the keeper
full and wide outside off. Hammered to long off
hits his helmet! Back of a length on off. Tries to pull but slips. The ball hits his head but Cutting says he's okay. Heat finish on 4 for 119
good length, on off, and cut through to the fielder at point
shoveled over long on! Full, just outside off, and put away
length ball, on leg and Khawaja makes some more room before paddling a sweep behind square. Effort from Prestwidge in the deep stops the boundary
through him! Full, on leg and Khawaja searches for the drive. Ball goes between bat and body to the keeper
full, on leg stump, and flicked to midwicket. Picks the fielder out though. Banton the man
slower ball, yorker length on leg, and flicked over midwicket. Ball in the gap near cow corner, but Cutting - from long on - runs across to intercept. Impressive start for Thunder
good length, outside off and skidding through. Under-edges the cut into the deck
gets him with the googly! Full, outside off and turning into Khawaja. Wants to sweep, but the ball goes through him. Pegs off stump back
good length, outside off. Cut to point
arm ball, outside leg stump. Mistimes the attempted pull to square leg
good length, on middle. Turns further away, and he pulls his first ball for a six over deep midwicket!

appeal for stumping from the keeper. Hales tried to cut his length ball, but may have raised his back foot while trying to get back into control. Looks like Hales' back leg was in the air, but it came down juuuuust in time
good length, on leg stump. Looks to swipe it behind square, but it hits his front leg before rolling away to the boundary

what a way to restart! Good length on off, and he goes for a massive leg-side swipe. In the air for ages, and the crowd thought it was a six too, but the fielder in the deep gets under it to take a smart catch
full, outside off and the attempted drive is sliced over point's head
top edged to the fine leg boundary. Short on middle, and the attempted pull runs away to the fence
slower ball, back of a length on off, and the attempted pull takes another top edge to the fine-leg fence
full and wide outside off. Gotta rebowl
full, on leg. The attempted drill to long on takes an inside edge to fine leg instead
good length, outside off. Slower ball. Cut to cover
back of a length, outside off. Makes room and guides it over the head of point for four
leg stump pegged back! Length, on middle, and the attempted leg-side swipe is missed by Morris
good length, on middle. Clears his front leg and muscled over cow corner
back of a length on off. Makes room and flat-bats it over the umpire's head. Ball rolls into the boundary line
hang time! Full, on leg, and the shot seemed to be going over long on, but Laughlin - from mid on - runs backwards to take a difficult catch falling backwards
wide yorker outside off. Dug away to mid off
full and wide outside off stump. Too wide though
yorker length, outside off again. May have been a wide, but this time it's been swiped to point
wide full toss outside off. Tries to slap it square, but under-edged into the deck and over the keeper's head. They scamper back for a few more
fullish outsie off, and the attempted swipe is edged over the vacant slip cordon for another four
low full toss on off. Driven to long on
yorker length, wide outside off. And tapped to point. Heat win by 16 runs (DLS method)
